fields.description:
Delete One Submodule will Delete all visible submodule entries of a repository.

Steps:
-Add Two different Submodules to a Repo
-Delete One of them with right click delete or by removing the submodule entry by hand from .gitmodules
-see all othervisual entries are gone 

Solution:
You forgot to call: 
-git rm --cached "full path" 
(Example: -git rm --cached Unity/dllProjects)

Doing so is the clean way and will solve the problem/symptome

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1260748/how-do-i-remove-a-submodule

You may want to Open Source SourceTree. I use it a lot and would solve those bugs in minutes.
fields.summary: Delete One Submodule will Delete all visible submodule entries of a repository.

fields.description:
When I attempt to 'clone' and I use sourcetree to scan the remote github repo, sourcetree has the little busy circle running.  It does not stop.  the gui does not show all my repos on github.  I'm trying to clone particular repos and I cannot access them via sourcetree.  

I have a mac and sourcetree does not have this problem.  I do need this to work on my windows workstation.

Thank You
fields.summary: sourcetree does not see all remote repos on github

fields.description:

When opening SourceTree and the repos are not open in tabs, and are stored in folders, they just show the double-arrow circle icon like they are still refreshing. After double clicking to open the repo in a tab the status updates in a few seconds.

After that, some of unstaging or staging manipulation will be failed with 'git apply' error(broken2.png).

fields.description:
There seem to be some UX issues if a branch name contains a comma. 

Steps to reproduce:
1) Create a branch called "A,B" (or anything else containing a comma) through the GUI
2) The branch is displayed as "A" in Log / History view
3) Checkout a different commit
4) Try to checkout the "A,B" branch by clicking on its head commit. It fails with the following message:

    git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false checkout A
    error: pathspec 'A' did not match any file(s) known to git.
    
    Completed with errors, see above.

Switching the branch by double-clicking on it in the sidebar works as expected. Attached is the repo for repro.
fields.summary: Cannot switch to branch with a comma in its name by clicking on a commit in Log / History view

fields.description:
I want to sort my tag by date/time
because my number is vx.x.x.0 running up to .10 .11 .12 ... .20 .21 ...
Your order is make me confuse
Thank you.
fields.summary: Can you add tag sort feature

fields.description:
git pull asks to cache the server key of a submodule but SourceTree crashes if I click Yes.

If I clone/new the submodule first - or even just get to the point where it has cached the server key and then cancel the clone - then I can use git pull on the original repo with the submodule.
fields.summary: Crash when caching server key of git submodule.

fields.description:
When trying to start interactive rebase it shows window with following message:


{panel}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c "sequence.editor='C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\stree_gri'" -c "core.editor='C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\stree_gri'" rebase -i --autosquash
There is no tracking information for the current branch.

Please specify which branch you want to rebase against.
See git-rebase(1) for details

    git rebase <branch>

If you wish to set tracking information for this branch you can do so with:

    git branch --set-upstream-to=<remote>/<branch> develop










Completed with errors, see above.

{panel}

fields.description:
Sourcetree is unable to connect to a Stash/Bitbucket Server instance on TLS 1.1/1.2 from the "Hosted Repositories" browser, and thus throwing out SSL related errors when trying to use the Repository browser. Cloning of and pushing to repositories in Sourcetree that are hosted on the Stash server is working even with strong encryption ciphers is working correctly though.

The workaround for this issue is to make changes to the SSL config on the apache proxy in front of Bitbucket Server to allow TLS 1.
fields.summary: SourceTree cannot display hosted projects on Repository Browser if strong ciphers (TLS 1.1 & 1.2) is used on Stash/Bitbucket Server

fields.description: Not able to open in terminal and it prompted me to report the bug with log

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Some users get a log in error in SourceTree when adding a Bitbucket Cloud account whose password has symbols like !@#$%^&*() ? 

h3. Environment
SourceTree 1.8.3 Windows

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Bitbucket account whose password contains a symbol, e.g. { or /
# Open SourceTree
# Go the View -> Repository Browser
# Click {{Edit account...}}
# Give the credentials for the Bitbucket account, leave protocol as HTTPS, click OK


h3. Expected Results
The account gets added in SourceTree

h3. Actual Results
A log in error is caused
fields.summary: Using a Bitbucket password with a symbol causes log in errors for some users

fields.description:
Customers who are behind an air-gapped system are unable to use SourceTree after installing, as they are unable to login to Atlassian or register an account.

There should be an option - like with version 1.7.x, to upload a registration key downloaded from the Internet onto the air-gapped system to complete registration.
fields.summary: Allow users to register offline or upload registrations

fields.description: this used to work.

In order to create a branch of my software with only selected cherry-picked commits,

  And a list of commit

fields.summary: As an enduser, I would like to be able to mark a commit with a kind of bookmark

fields.description:
On attempting to update to version 1.8.3 fails on the installer run. and then gets stuck in a loop  Details are as follows.
[SEH_AV_READ_BADPTR] ACCESS_VIOLATION (0xc0000005) at address [0x00ca37c2]

Advanced Installer Enhanced UI 12.7.2 build 68656
*** Stack Trace (x86) ***

[0x00ca37c2]  -----
[0x00c6b21e]  -----
[0x775f9a02]  RtlInitializeExceptionChain()
[0x775f99d5]  RtlInitializeExceptionChain()
[0x00c00000]  MODULE_BASE_ADDRESS
Failed first three times... 
On last attempt worked without issue... ? I closed source tree immediately update selecting check for updates in the About sourcetree menu. When it worked. Maybe the check for a running instance is failing ?
fields.summary: Advanced updater fails to update sourcetree.

fields.description:
Since the v1.8 release came out, we have been presented with an updated look and feel on the user interface. However, I find that the updated styling reduced the visual appeal substantially. Furthermore, it is my contention that the new styling increases my mental energy required to use the UI, because of the lower contrast on the icon set styling. The new style is monotonic in color, with very few distinctive features in the user interface to help one use the software.

Compare that to the v1.7 styling that used colors very well to guide one's eye easily to important aspects of the UI. Attached are screenshots of the v1.7 and v1.8 styles. Note in the v1.7 styling how easy it is to distinguish between the working copy, folders, remote and local branches. The color in the icons serve a substantial purpose there. In the v1.8 styling all one has to go by is the monotonic icons with thin lines that require unnecessary mental energy to distinguish the UI elements.

Please consider restoring some sensible coloring to the UI elements, to allow for better contrast. Thanks.
fields.summary: Increase contrast in icons and overall theme

fields.description:
After update source tree to latest version, the tree view features (as in screenshot below) which exist in previous version (1.6) seem has been removed. Please include the tree view features as it is helpful when categorize the changes.

 !Tree View Features Screenshot in Source Tree 1.6.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Tree View in new version of Source Tree

fields.description:
When a file deletion forms part of the merge conflicts it is possible that the external Merge tool will not respond. SourceTree gives no indication of why.

For more details see https://support.atlassian.com/browse/STSP-3408
fields.summary: Improve the handling of deleted files in a merge via an external merge tool

fields.description: Whenever I want to push/pull my changes, this dialog box appears and nothing else happens.
fields.summary: AskPass crashes

fields.description:
I believe that the SourceTree client needs an option in the proxy configuration to ignore domains and go "DIRECT" , in other words allow one to specify "no_proxy" in the configuration screen.

Within our company we have proxy servers where internal servers are not listed, and the DNS is used instead. 

So what happens is we need to switch between "Use System Settings" for internal servers, and "Proxy Settings" & "Add Configuration to Git/Mecurial" for Github. It becomes tedious. 

Plus it prevents the ability to create a subtree/submodule from an external -> internal source since it's unable to resolve the sources through the proxy and direct at the same time. 

Unfortunately the "Add Configuration to Git/Mecurial" seem to break connecting to internal servers, but necessary for external.

To make this less confusing, it may help to add the ignore for certain domains such as localhost & .mycompanydomain.com to work just like a "no_proxy" 

I tried the below with no luck

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/14932/using-proxies-with-sourcetree

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/12162658/ignoring-proxy-settings-for-internal-git-server

I'm looking forward to seeing this implemented in a future version of SourceTree , as I don't see how to do it in the current without a lot of effort - thanks!
fields.summary: Proxy server configuration for internal & external servers - add NO_PROXY

fields.description:
The checkboxes introduced in 1.6 are horrible from a UX perspective, but at least it was still possible to drag files too. 
This whole dragging support doesn't work anymore since the upgrade to 1.8.3.0.

Maybe this is an attempt to force people to use the checkboxes, but for me it's a dealbreaker. This is not how a checklistbox should be used, and if I get used to this behaviour, it will confuse me in other applications that do use them in a normal way.
fields.summary: Dragging file from unstaged to staged doesn't work anymore

fields.description: I used to right-click branches, and in the context popup I would find the possibility to add a new branch. Since the upgrade to 1.8.3.0 this doesn't work anymore. Right-click doesn't show anything anymore.
fields.summary: Right-click on 'Brances' to create new branch doesn't work anymore.

fields.description: If you add or remove a large number of files in a single commit, it opens a confirmation dialog that lists all the files names. This dialog is taller than the height of the screen, so you can't see the buttons to click on so you have to press Enter and hope.
fields.summary: Add/Remove files confirmation dialog does not fit on screen

fields.description:
After upgrade from a earlier version of SourceTree it lost all preferences/settings and I am now unable to configure it to use mercurial.
On boot it asks me how I want to configure Mercurial:
* If I select "Download an embedded version", it crashes immediately
* If I select "Browse to the location on your system" and I point to a locally installed mercurial, then it comes back to the choices for mercurial (download embedded, browse locally, ...) and clicking again on "Browse to the location..." just does nothing.
* "Check again (should you wish...." option just seems to do nothing, despite hg.exe being in my PATH
* The only option that allows to exit that safely is "I don't want to use mercurial"

See the attached logs
fields.summary: Crash when selecting "Download Embedded Mercurial" in 1.8.3
Add the possibility to search trough the list of the bookmarks. I have lots of projects added and it became very difficult to find one.

fields.description:
Reproduce:
# Select a repository, right click then rename.
# Use mouse to select any letters by click & drag.
# Once you drag the mouse, the control will consider you are moving/reordering the repository rather than select multiple letters in the textbox.
fields.summary: Unable to select letters when renaming a repository

fields.description: When using the Putty SSH agent, the first operation requests command line input that is not possible to provide in the status window. See attached image.
fields.summary: Unable to provide putty input when requested

fields.description: After a commit and a push, SourceTree will generally go back to the "Working Copy" section. But occasionally, the interface changes to the branch's Log/History section instead of "Working Copy" where I was previously looking at. This happened 2 out of 10 times for me.
fields.summary: The interface occasionally changes to the branch's Log/History section instead of "Working Copy" where generally it should stick at.

fields.description:
During the setup when I was asked for my BITBUCKET username and password I used my email address in place of my username. I was allowed to complete the wizard (with an error) and this created a situation where SourceTree was unable to function correctly when connecting to BitBucket and produces a misleading error that seems like there's a firewall issue. (Sorry I didn't write it down)

User is required to go to Settings / Edit Accounts to make another connection attempt, and only in this screen is the user told "HEY YOU CAN'T USE AN EMAIL FOR YOUR USERNAME".  Entering the proper username fixed the issue.

If you were to inform the user during the setup wizard that an email is not a valid username  that would solve this issue.
fields.summary: User incorrectly allowed to use email address as username in setup wizard

fields.description:
SourceTree for Windows 1.8.3.0
Before 1.6.25, External diff was enabled for any two commits. After version 1.8, External Diff is enabled only for unstaged files.
fields.summary: Bring back External Diff for code that is already commited

fields.description:
When stashing changes, and with the "Stash staged changes" checkbox unchecked, the staged changes get stashed none the less, and removed from the workspace.

This wouldn't be so bad by itself, except that there is no way to apply only part of a stashed change to the current branch. So when I want to stash changes to only a single file, from a total of 5 files, it becomes painful, especially doing a dance of "commit these, stash that, apply stash, edit stashed changes, edit again", etc.
fields.summary: Stashing changes includes staged changes

fields.description: If Custom Action is configured with the option "Open in separate window", the title (and the minimize button) is not displayed as in the version prior to 1.8. As a result, it is impossible to minimize the progress window.
fields.summary: Lost the progress window title of the custom actions

fields.description:
As of *Version 1.8.3* (not in Version selector), selecting the checkbox above the list of files in a commit no longer toggles all files off or on.  This means manually selected each and every file, which is very tedious (and error prone).

 !image-2016-03-28-12-23-04-214.png|thumbnail! 

Clicking on checkbox does nothing now.
fields.summary: Checkbox no longer selects all issues

fields.description: I double-click the file that was created by visual studio on the log/history panal of sourcetree
fields.summary: crash when open the file created by visual studio

fields.description:
If you get prompted for credentials and enter incorrect credentials with 'Remember me' ticked, it remembers the incorrect credentials.

The remember feature should not remember the password for the username, nor remember the username as the default user for a connection unless the authentication was successful.

I found the issue when pushing to github, but I suspect it would happen for other origin repository types too.
fields.summary: Remember credentials saves credentials even if they are incorrect

fields.description: Add option for "--squash" when merging git branches.
fields.summary: Add "squash" option to merge (Windows)

fields.description:
Norton Security reports Trojan.Gen.SMH  in  GitK.exe on initial install and automatically quarantines the .exe.

This is using the standalone
fields.summary: Trojan.Gen.SMH found in GitK.exe on initial install

fields.description: Bug with check box. It doesn't select all files. look at the attached picture. I used mercurial.
fields.summary: Bug with "select all" check box (commit changes tab).

fields.description:
1. Open Options -> General and enable "Always display full console output"
2. Click to stage (or unstage) all changed files (lower part)

SourceTree will break and it will stuck with spinner in both staging and unstaging. If you click on single file to stage/unstage after that, it will move all. 

I think full console output is value for all actions except stage/unstage, but it can stay even it would be a value to allow users to chose what actions they want to see as a full output (for example pushes and pulls).
fields.summary: Staging blocking if "Show full console..." enabled in settings

fields.description:
No longer able to drag n drop individual or multiple files to/from the staging area. Was a huge time saver, having to individually click separate files dramatically slows down process of added or updating large amounts of files.
Using split view staging.
fields.summary: Unable to drag n drop files to stage anymore

fields.description:
Trying to commit changes to an existing repository results in Sourcetree crashing.

The repository is Mercurial, freshly checked out from a Bitbucket repo.  It checks out fine.  Re-installing and/or updating Sourcetree does not fix the crash.  When first installed on this computer I vaguely recall the Sourcetree installer having some issues and crashing/having to be restarted, but I really don't recall details so this may be irrelevant.  This is the first time using Sourcetree on this computer since then.  Subsequent reinstalls did not give any errors.

Upon looking at the log, it crashed with a NullReferenceException in the function call SourceTree.Accounts.AccountManager.GetDefaultUserInformation().  I went to the Tools->Options menu, General tab, and my name and email were blank.  I filled them in and the commit completed and pushed with no issues.

Log file is attached.  Thank you, hopefully this should be an easy fix.
fields.summary: Making a commit with no default username crashes

fields.description: When commiting, the submodule window that verifies if it is uptodate opened. Some changes were reported so I cliked on "Open..." and it crashed.
fields.summary: Sourcetree crash when clicking "Open.." on submodule change verification window

fields.description: New version installation give me an error
fields.summary: update & installation error

fields.description:
I cannot add changes any more. Whenever I click the checkbox next to the files I want to add, a spinner appears in the top "staged files" area and the action never completes. When it happens the UI is still responsive (I can change tabs, etc). The screenshot I am attaching was taken after waiting 10 minutes after clicking the add all checkbox.

However, if I restart the client, the changes will have been staged successfully and will also commit successfully. It's a big hassle to have to restart the client on every commit. It also doesn't happen on every single add but only in about 50% of cases. Restarting the program/computer doesn't help.

This started happening with the same release that changed the UI to be grey.
fields.summary: Cannot stage changes any more

fields.description:
!image-2016-03-25-12-14-40-014.png|thumbnail! 
As you know, to add an unstaged file, the shortcut key (or hotkey) is

Ctrl + Shift + Plus sign.

This worked when using the Plus sign that's next to the Backspace key.

This K330 keyboard has a number pad keys.
 !image-2016-03-25-12-16-37-881.png|thumbnail! 
So I tried the Plus sign key that's located at the number pad keys.
*However, it didn't work. Adding unstaged files failed when I used that key.*

I used other combinations like
Crtl + Plus key (located at the number pad keys)
Crtl + Shift + Plus key (located at the number pad keys)

I want to know that is this the problem with my Logitech device.
Or if other keybord products show the same results, I hope this bug to be fixed.

-Best Regards
fields.summary: Add shortcut key isn't perfect

fields.description: When pushing to remote repo error box is displayed with message, the essence is above.
fields.summary: SourceTree ERR_remove_thread_state not located LIBEAY32.dll

Hi,

For example, having twice the thickness of others.

Jawwad

fields.description: When I delete a branch in a repo on gitlab i.e. in a VM. And then refresh remote status, the branch does not disappear. I have to manually do git fetch -p to get an update on deleted branches. Fetch and Pull aren't updating the deletion of the branch neither.

fields.description:
SourceTree window keeps refreshing when files change, even though the files are in ignored paths. 

This makes impossible using SourceTree with running processes that change files in project subdirectories. 

Problem stops when auto-refresh is turned OFF. However, best solution would be to stop watching ignored files (.gitignore).
fields.summary: change file

fields.description:
I've got a fork of a github repo. The main repo is, alphabetically, before my repo.

In my fork I have a tag that I want to delete.

If I delete tag from all repos (I can't see how I delete a tag from 1 repo, so if that's what is required to fix this issue, please let me know), the repos are processed alphabetically.

Firstly the local tag is deleted, and then, as the first repo doesn't have the tag, the git command fails and that aborts the remainder of the repos, leaving the tag still on the remote repo.

I'm left with no local tag, but if I refresh my copy from remote, I get the tag back.
fields.summary: Deleting tag that only exists on 1 remote repo fails

It would be a good idea in my eyes to be able to either make keyboard shortcuts or customize the ribbon to be able to quickly access either a certain Action or the Action Menu.

fields.description:
I had just started typing a commit message when the app crashed.

{code:title=Stack Trace|borderStyle=solid}
ERROR [2016-03-23 20:16:08,192] [1] [SourceTree.AppRoot] [HandleCrash] - Fatal error
System.Runtime.InteropServices.COMException (0x800706BA): The RPC server is unavailable. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x800706BA)
   at System.Windows.Documents.WinRTSpellerInterop.ISpellChecker.ComprehensiveCheck(String text)
   at System.Windows.Documents.WinRTSpellerInterop.SpellerSegment.EnumerateSuggestions()
   at System.Windows.Documents.WinRTSpellerInterop.SpellerSegment.get_IsClean()
   at System.Windows.Documents.Speller.ScanTextSegment(ISpellerSegment textSegment, Object o)
   at System.Windows.Documents.WinRTSpellerInterop.EnumTextSegments(Char[] text, Int32 count, EnumSentencesCallback sentenceCallback, EnumTextSegmentsCallback segmentCallback, Object data)
   at System.Windows.Documents.Speller.ScanRange(ITextPointer start, ITextPointer end, Int64 timeLimit)
   at System.Windows.Documents.Speller.OnIdle(Object unused)
   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs)
   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.TryCatchWhen(Object source, Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs, Delegate catchHandler)

{code}
fields.summary: source tree crash while typing commit message

fields.description: To enhance the branching graphic to clearly distinguish between closed and open branches. Ref to the attached picture for an example
fields.summary: Clearly marking a branch as closed

fields.description: It would be really useful to be able to generate release notes from SourceTree
fields.summary: Release Note Generator

fields.description:
After a couple of time (more than 60 minutes) each try to do a SSH connection by a button or command, like Pull or Push fails. Sourcetree sems to hang until we abort manual (see scrennshot, this message keeps open for a long time).

Opening a bash shell and manual executing the commands show under "display all" are working.

After closing and restart Sourcetree it's again working for some time.
fields.summary: SourceTree hangs on SSH connections after a couple of time

fields.description:
Selecting a commit - choose rebase interactive. Change something. And it will always fail [or at least i cannot find a working path]. 

There are also ways to get git locked itself ...
fields.summary: Git rebase --interactive does not work

fields.description:
SourceTree window keeps refreshing when files change, even though the files are in ignored paths. 

This makes impossible using SourceTree with running processes that change files in project subdirectories. 

Problem stops when auto-refresh is turned OFF. However, best solution would be to stop watching ignored files (.gitignore).
fields.summary: Do not refresh if ignored files change

fields.description: Sometimes I create a branch to play around with and only want to pull a file or two into my main branch.  It would be great to look at another commit and be able to check out individual files from that commit.  From the command line you do it with 'git checkout <commit> -- path/to/file', but that can get cumbersome.
fields.summary: Pick files from another commit
bug test
test

fields.description: test
fields.summary: Test

fields.description:
When viewing the repository history, the screen will periodically flash, presumably when the software is refreshing the working copy status. When this happens, the selected position in the repo history list, and changeset file list, will be reset to the first entry.

This makes both keyboard navigation and viewing changesets difficult, as the selected changeset or file is reset essentially randomly.
fields.summary: SourceTree resets focus when checking status

fields.description:
When trying to look into any of my projects and branches I see the following exception (see attached screenshot)

Before update to 1.8.2.11 everything worked fine.
fields.summary: Source Tree not working after latest update - can not look into any of my projects

fields.description:
After a while (I have so far been unable to find a method to reproduce consistently), SourceTree simply stops showing the content of the editors (Diff & Commit Chain). The only solution so far is to close & restart SourceTree.

Occasionally it happens after a commit. 
Ocassionally it happens if I open a repository from the side-bar
fields.summary: Sourcetree fails to show diffs or commits after a while and requires a restart

fields.description:
There's a usability problem with the way conflicts are presented that is inconsistent with git status output.

There's no visual distinction between the three major conflict types:

1. A & B Changed
2. A Changed & B Removed
3. A Removed & B Changed

This is problematic because each of these requires a different resolution step, for 1 you merge the file with an external tool. For 2 or 3 you choose to take thiers / mine (usually). This requires you to know if it's missing from a certain branch and which one it's missing from.

Git Status gives us a nice output (see attached picture) and some similar tools to Source Tree make the distinction.

To further the problem, simply running down your conflicts and launching your external merge tool will usually just hang at the screen reminding you to close your tool (Which never opened) before continuting.

Can we please add some kind of visual indication, either distinct icons, or some kind of information in the diff view (which is often unable to produce a result).

If you want to test what I mean please use this sample repository:

https://github.com/Reanmachine/sourcetree-conflict-bug

Merge "other_branch" into "master" and see the conflicts in action:
fields.summary: Unable to distinguish Conflict Type during merge - External Tool Fails

fields.description:
I just upgraded SourceTree and the folder icons lost their color :-(  In fact, almost all the icons seem to have lost their color.  What's wrong with color?  It's easier to see the structure of our nested branches when the folder icon has some color.  Please don't sacrifice functionality for aesthetics.  I wish I had not upgraded.
Thank you.
fields.summary: Colored folder icons?

fields.description:
If the default user information contains an apostrophe (As in O'Connell), commits have the author "unknown <username@hostname>", as demonstrated below. "Test Commit" was after changing default user information to remove the apostrophe. No other settings were changed.

{code}
$ git log
commit 9b21fd9d166928a21e036a41e1bd73096ce6368e
Author: Zoe OConnell <zoe@metail.co.uk>
Date:   Mon Mar 21 15:45:06 2016 +0000

    Test Commit

commit e0d8897da17cc04f6014b14e798743e86a506612
Author: unknown <zoe@justinian.corp.metail.org>
Date:   Mon Mar 21 12:27:52 2016 +0000

    ...

commit 71c58fc6f3b84deb8a340bb9bec838e77b22c32d
Author: unknown <zoe@justinian.corp.metail.org>
Date:   Mon Mar 21 11:57:38 2016 +0000

    ...

commit a67752d119f2ac1b6d436089359e16f19bb20c8c
Author: unknown <zoe@justinian.corp.metail.org>
Date:   Thu Mar 17 09:57:37 2016 +0000

    Initial Commit
{code}
fields.summary: Incorrect handling of apostrophes

When on log view and wanting to switch branches on the same commit by right clicking on the same commit. The _Checkout..._ option is greyed out.

Have to find the branch manually in the branch. Bit of a pain.
fields.summary: Can't switch branches when on same commit

fields.description: It would be great to be able to allow stashing untracked files as well in the stash dialog (--include-untracked option on GIT's commandline).

Tried to search repo by starting to type in the Search input box in the sourcetree main window. Crashes 100% of the time.

See attached log
